Float an element

The float utility function applies Bootstrap float classes to a tag element. These classes cause a tag element to float to the left or right in its parent element. Alternatively, specify "none" to remove the elementâ€™s float. The float utilities are viewport responsive.

Arguments

tag

A tag element.

default

One of "left", "right", or "none" specifying the default float of the element.

sm

Like default, but the float is applied once the viewport is 576 pixels wide, think phone in landscape mode.

md

Like default, but the float is applied once the viewport is 768 pixels wide, think tablets.

lg

Like default, but the float is applied once the viewport is 992 pixels wide, think desktop.

xl

Like default, but the float is applied once the viewport is 1200 pixels wide, think large desktop.

Source
